title: Dengue
content: Dengue is a viral infection spread by Aedes mosquitoes. It commonly causes high fever, severe joint and muscle pain, rash, and headache. In most cases patients recover, but severe dengue can cause bleeding and require hospitalization.

title: Malaria
content: Malaria is caused by Plasmodium parasites transmitted by Anopheles mosquitoes. Symptoms include cycles of fever, chills, sweating, and general weakness. Early diagnosis and antimalarial treatment are important.

title: Tuberculosis
content: Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial infection that usually affects the lungs and can cause prolonged cough, weight loss, night sweats, and fever. TB is diagnosed using sputum tests and chest X-rays and treated with a course of antibiotics over months.

title: Diabetes
content: Diabetes mellitus is a metabolic disorder characterized by high blood sugar levels. Symptoms may include excessive thirst, frequent urination, fatigue, and blurred vision. Management includes diet, exercise and medications such as insulin or oral agents.

title: Hypertension
content: Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is often asymptomatic but increases risk of heart disease and stroke. Some people report headaches or dizziness; diagnosis is by measuring blood pressure and management includes lifestyle changes and medications.
